author: Reuters Editorial
title: UPDATE 1-Exchange operator ICE's profit tops estimates on higher trading volumes
text:
May 3, 2018 / 11:59 AM / Updated 20 minutes ago UPDATE 1-Exchange operator ICE's profit tops estimates on higher trading volumes Reuters Staff 2 Min Read
(Adds details)
May 3 (Reuters) - Intercontinental Exchange Inc, owner of the New York Stock Exchange, posted first-quarter profit that beat estimates as a spike in market volatility pushed trading volumes higher.
Volatility surged in February after a prolonged calm in 2017, roiling global equities, bonds, currencies and commodities markets, with turbulence remaining elevated through the end of March, benefiting exchange operators.
Revenue from the transaction and clearing unit, its biggest business, rose 12.5 percent to $898 million.
Revenue from its data services unit, which publishes daily indexes and historical price data, remained unchanged from the year-ago quarter.
Net income attributable to the company fell to $464 million, or 79 cents per share, in the first quarter ended March 31, from $503 million, or 84 cents per share, a year earlier.
On an adjusted basis, the company earned 90 per share, beating analystsâ€™ estimate of 88 cents per share, according to Thomson Reuters I/B/E/S.
Total revenue, excluding transaction-based expenses, rose 5 percent to $1.23 billion. (Reporting by Nikhil Subba in Bengaluru; Editing by Shailesh Kuber)
